intro: Soehrensia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy soehrensia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale green, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Soehrensia strigosa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
